review: We tried an Amazon Fire Stick but had to return it because it did not stream properly. It would freeze up and then quickly fly through what had been missed. So we took it back to the store where we purchased it and exchanged it for another one. The second one did the same as the first. We took the second one back and exchanged it for a Roku 3. We have had no problems wih the Roku
author: Mimi

review: It worked well for about a month and then I made the mistake of installing a few apps (hbo go, netflix, showtime). Now it barely works - buffering, errors, saying I have bad Internet (I do not). I have to do the app force stop, clear data - sometimes that fixes things. My TV and DVD player both are wireless connected/app capable and they are FINE. I like to test it out by switching from a terrible buffering amazon stick right over to my tv apps where it is perfectly fine. I have removed all additional apps and only use it for Amazon and it works the majority of the time as opposed to none of the time...so I guess thats an improvement? I am considering calling Amazon...maybe I have a bad unit? Though based on the troubleshooting threads I have found I am certainly not the only one.
author: Tabitha

review: This was so easy to install, I spent more time dreading it than it actually took. It set itself up and when we lost power, it rebooted itself
author: A. Crickmer "Frugal Consumer"

review: I am extremely pleased with Amazon Fire TV Stick. It has lived up to my expectations, and more. As a senior, I am not able to install, or understand many of today's technical items. The directions were very clear and easy to follow. Within ten minutes, the Fire Stick was installed, and working. Also, the content is incredible and I still haven't seen much of what the Stick has to offer. My music and photos stored on Amazon Cloud, are on the screen with the touch of a button. The Fire Stick is well worth the price Amazon is charging. Great buy.
author: Julie
